trans-unit.source: Log in from the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Log in from the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Connect to Azure subscription from the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)
trans-unit.target: Connect to Azure subscription from the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)

trans-unit.source: Connect to an Azure subscription from the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)
trans-unit.target: Connect to an Azure subscription from the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)

trans-unit.source: The Azure CLI is a set of open source, cross-platform commands for working with the Azure Platform.
trans-unit.target: The Azure CLI is a set of open source, cross-platform commands for working with the Azure Platform.

trans-unit.source: This document describes how to connect to your Azure subscription from the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: This document describes how to connect to your Azure subscription from the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: For installation instructions, see [Install Azure CLI](xplat-cli-install.md).
trans-unit.target: For installation instructions, see [Install Azure CLI](xplat-cli-install.md).

trans-unit.source: How to connect to your Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: How to connect to your Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Most commands provided by the Azure CLI require a connection to an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Most commands provided by the Azure CLI require a connection to an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to configure the Azure CLI to work with your subscription:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to configure the Azure CLI to work with your subscription:

trans-unit.source: Log in to Azure using a work or school account (also called an organizational account).
trans-unit.target: Log in to Azure using a work or school account (also called an organizational account).

trans-unit.source: This uses Azure Active Directory to authenticate the credentials.
trans-unit.target: This uses Azure Active Directory to authenticate the credentials.

trans-unit.source: or
trans-unit.target: or

trans-unit.source: Download and use a publish settings file.
trans-unit.target: Download and use a publish settings file.

trans-unit.source: This installs a certificate that allows you to perform management tasks for as long as the subscription and the certificate are valid.
trans-unit.target: This installs a certificate that allows you to perform management tasks for as long as the subscription and the certificate are valid.

trans-unit.source: For more information about authentication and subscription management, see ["What's the difference between account-based authentication and certificate-based authentication"][authandsub].
trans-unit.target: For more information about authentication and subscription management, see ["What's the difference between account-based authentication and certificate-based authentication"][authandsub].

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial][free-trial].
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial][free-trial].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The most flexible and advanced Azure services use the Azure Resource Manager or the [ARM mode](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The most flexible and advanced Azure services use the Azure Resource Manager or the [ARM mode](xplat-cli-azure-resource-manager.md).

trans-unit.source: The ARM mode requires connecting to Azure using a work or school account, with the log in method described below.
trans-unit.target: The ARM mode requires connecting to Azure using a work or school account, with the log in method described below.

trans-unit.source: Use the log in method
trans-unit.target: Use the log in method

trans-unit.source: The login method only works with a work or school account.
trans-unit.target: The login method only works with a work or school account.

trans-unit.source: This account is managed by your organization, and defined in your organization's Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: This account is managed by your organization, and defined in your organization's Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you do not currently have a work or school account, and are using a personal account to log in to your Azure subscription, you can easily create one using the following steps.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you do not currently have a work or school account, and are using a personal account to log in to your Azure subscription, you can easily create one using the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Login to the [Azure Portal][portal], and select **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: Login to the [Azure Portal][portal], and select **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: If no directory exists, select **Create your directory** and provide the requested information.
trans-unit.target: If no directory exists, select **Create your directory** and provide the requested information.

trans-unit.source: Select your directory and add a new user.
trans-unit.target: Select your directory and add a new user.

trans-unit.source: This new user is a work or school account.
trans-unit.target: This new user is a work or school account.

trans-unit.source: During the creation of the user, you will be supplied with both an e-mail address for the user and a temporary password.
trans-unit.target: During the creation of the user, you will be supplied with both an e-mail address for the user and a temporary password.

trans-unit.source: Save this information as it is needed later.
trans-unit.target: Save this information as it is needed later.

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, select **Settings** and then select **Administrators**.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, select **Settings** and then select **Administrators**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Add**, and add the new user as a co-administrator.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add**, and add the new user as a co-administrator.

trans-unit.source: This allows the work or school account to manage your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: This allows the work or school account to manage your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Finally, log out of the Azure portal and then log back in using the new work or school account.
trans-unit.target: Finally, log out of the Azure portal and then log back in using the new work or school account.

trans-unit.source: If this is the first time logging in with this account, you will be prompted to change the password.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first time logging in with this account, you will be prompted to change the password.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you see your subscriptions when you log in as the work or school account.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you see your subscriptions when you log in as the work or school account.

trans-unit.source: For more information on work or school accounts, see [Sign up for Microsoft Azure as an Organization][signuporg].
trans-unit.target: For more information on work or school accounts, see [Sign up for Microsoft Azure as an Organization][signuporg].

trans-unit.source: To log in from the Azure CLI using a work or school account, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To log in from the Azure CLI using a work or school account, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: and enter your password when prompted for.
trans-unit.target: and enter your password when prompted for.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If this is the first time you have logged in with these credentials, you will receive a prompt asking you to verify that you wish to cache an authentication token.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If this is the first time you have logged in with these credentials, you will receive a prompt asking you to verify that you wish to cache an authentication token.

trans-unit.source: This prompt will also occur if you have previously used the `azure logout` command described below.
trans-unit.target: This prompt will also occur if you have previously used the `azure logout` command described below.

trans-unit.source: To bypass this prompt for automation scenarios, use the `-q` parameter with the `azure login` command.
trans-unit.target: To bypass this prompt for automation scenarios, use the `-q` parameter with the `azure login` command.

trans-unit.source: To log out, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To log out, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If the subscriptions associated with the account were only authenticated with Active Directory, logging out will delete the subscription information from the local profile.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If the subscriptions associated with the account were only authenticated with Active Directory, logging out will delete the subscription information from the local profile.

trans-unit.source: However, if a publish settings file had also been imported for the subscriptions, logging out will only delete the Active Directory related information from the local profile.
trans-unit.target: However, if a publish settings file had also been imported for the subscriptions, logging out will only delete the Active Directory related information from the local profile.

trans-unit.source: Use the publish settings file method
trans-unit.target: Use the publish settings file method

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you connect using this method, you can only use the Azure Service Management (or the ASM mode) commands.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you connect using this method, you can only use the Azure Service Management (or the ASM mode) commands.

trans-unit.source: To download the publish settings for your account, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: To download the publish settings for your account, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: This will open your default browser and prompt you to sign in to the [Azure Portal][portal].
trans-unit.target: This will open your default browser and prompt you to sign in to the [Azure Portal][portal].

trans-unit.source: After signing in, a `.publishsettings` file will be downloaded.
trans-unit.target: After signing in, a `.publishsettings` file will be downloaded.

trans-unit.source: Make note of where this file is saved.
trans-unit.target: Make note of where this file is saved.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If your account is associated with multiple Azure Active Directory tenants, you may be prompted to select which Active Directory you wish to download a publish settings file for.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If your account is associated with multiple Azure Active Directory tenants, you may be prompted to select which Active Directory you wish to download a publish settings file for.

trans-unit.source: Once selected using the download page, or by visiting the Azure Portal, the selected Active Directory becomes the default used by the portal and download page.
trans-unit.target: Once selected using the download page, or by visiting the Azure Portal, the selected Active Directory becomes the default used by the portal and download page.

trans-unit.source: Once a default has been established, you will see the text '__click here to return to the selection page__' at the top of the download page.
trans-unit.target: Once a default has been established, you will see the text '__click here to return to the selection page__' at the top of the download page.

trans-unit.source: Use the provided link to return to the selection page.
trans-unit.target: Use the provided link to return to the selection page.

trans-unit.source: Next, import the `.publishsettings` file by running the following command:
trans-unit.target: Next, import the `.publishsettings` file by running the following command:

trans-unit.source: After importing your publish settings, you should delete the `.publishsettings` file, as it is no longer required by the Azure CLI and presents a security risk as it can be used to gain access to your subscription.
trans-unit.target: After importing your publish settings, you should delete the `.publishsettings` file, as it is no longer required by the Azure CLI and presents a security risk as it can be used to gain access to your subscription.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Whether you login with a work or school account or import publish settings, the information for accessing your Azure subscription is stored in a `.azure` directory located in your `user` directory.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Whether you login with a work or school account or import publish settings, the information for accessing your Azure subscription is stored in a `.azure` directory located in your `user` directory.

trans-unit.source: Your `user` directory is protected by your operating system; however, it is recommended that you take additional steps to encrypt your `user` directory.
trans-unit.target: Your `user` directory is protected by your operating system; however, it is recommended that you take additional steps to encrypt your `user` directory.

trans-unit.source: You can do so in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: You can do so in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: On Windows, modify the directory properties or use BitLocker.
trans-unit.target: On Windows, modify the directory properties or use BitLocker.

trans-unit.source: On Mac, turn on FileVault for the directory.
trans-unit.target: On Mac, turn on FileVault for the directory.

trans-unit.source: On Ubuntu, use the Encrypted Home directory feature.
trans-unit.target: On Ubuntu, use the Encrypted Home directory feature.

trans-unit.source: Other Linux distributions offer equivalent features.
trans-unit.target: Other Linux distributions offer equivalent features.

trans-unit.source: Multiple subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Multiple subscriptions

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, connecting to Azure will grant access to all subscriptions associated with your credentials.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, connecting to Azure will grant access to all subscriptions associated with your credentials.

trans-unit.source: One subscription will be selected as the default, and used by the Azure CLI when performing operations.
trans-unit.target: One subscription will be selected as the default, and used by the Azure CLI when performing operations.

trans-unit.source: You can view the subscriptions, as well as which one is the default, using the `azure account list` command.
trans-unit.target: You can view the subscriptions, as well as which one is the default, using the `azure account list` command.

trans-unit.source: This command will return information similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: This command will return information similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: In the above list, the **Current** column indicates the current default subscription as Azure-sub-1.
trans-unit.target: In the above list, the **Current** column indicates the current default subscription as Azure-sub-1.

trans-unit.source: To change the default subscription, use the `azure account set` command, and specify the subscription that you wish to be the default.
trans-unit.target: To change the default subscription, use the `azure account set` command, and specify the subscription that you wish to be the default.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: This will change the default subscription to Azure-sub-2.
trans-unit.target: This will change the default subscription to Azure-sub-2.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Changing the default subscription takes effect immediately, and is a global change; new Azure CLI commands, whether you run them from the same command-line instance or a different instance, will use the new default subscription.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Changing the default subscription takes effect immediately, and is a global change; new Azure CLI commands, whether you run them from the same command-line instance or a different instance, will use the new default subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to use a non-default subscription with the Azure CLI, but don't want to change the current default, you can use the `--subscription` option for the command and provide the name of the subscription you wish to use for the operation.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to use a non-default subscription with the Azure CLI, but don't want to change the current default, you can use the `--subscription` option for the command and provide the name of the subscription you wish to use for the operation.

trans-unit.source: Once you are connected to your Azure subscription, you can start using the Azure CLI commands.
trans-unit.target: Once you are connected to your Azure subscription, you can start using the Azure CLI commands.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to use the Azure CLI](xplat-cli.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to use the Azure CLI](xplat-cli.md).

trans-unit.source: Additional resources
trans-unit.target: Additional resources

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure CLI with the Service Management (or ASM mode) commands
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure CLI with the Service Management (or ASM mode) commands

trans-unit.target: Using the Azure CLI with the Resource Management (or ARM mode) commands

trans-unit.source: For more information on the Azure CLI, to download source code, report problems, or contribute to the project, visit the [GitHub repository for the Azure CLI](https://github.com/azure/azure-xplat-cli).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the Azure CLI, to download source code, report problems, or contribute to the project, visit the [GitHub repository for the Azure CLI](https://github.com/azure/azure-xplat-cli).

trans-unit.source: If you encounter problems using the Azure CLI, or Azure, visit the [Azure Forums](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home).
trans-unit.target: If you encounter problems using the Azure CLI, or Azure, visit the [Azure Forums](http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsazure/home).

trans-unit.source: For more information on Azure, see [http://azure.microsoft.com/](http://azure.microsoft.com).
trans-unit.target: For more information on Azure, see [http://azure.microsoft.com/](http://azure.microsoft.com).
